captures.author: @claudeai
captures.text: Ads are coming to AI. But not to Claude. Keep thinking.
captures.whyInteresting: Official Claude account making a bold positioning statement - ad-free AI as differentiator. 37K likes shows massive resonance.

captures.author: @aakashgupta
captures.text: Anthropic wiped $285 billion off global software stocks with 11 open-source plugins. Text files on GitHub. Markdown and JSON configs that tell Claude how to do specific jobs like reviewing contracts, prepping sales calls, and analyzing financial data...
captures.whyInteresting: Deep breakdown of the SaaSpocalypse - how simple config files triggered massive market crash. Thomson Reuters -18%, RELX -14%, LegalZoom -20%.

captures.author: @aakashgupta
captures.text: The creator of Claude Code just told you the entire RAG industry is solving the wrong problem and nobody is repricing. Boris Cherny built Claude Code from scratch...
captures.whyInteresting: Boris Cherny says grep beats RAG for code. 'Vibes-based' evaluation. Agentic search outperformed sophisticated retrieval. $81B RAG market in question.

captures.author: @MatznerJon
captures.text: This is either going to be the best or worst idea I've ever had. Hooked up my OpenClaw to all of our internet connected cameras at the house. Got this this (OUT OF NOWHERE) this morning.
captures.whyInteresting: OpenClaw in the wild! Someone connected it to home cameras. 3.7K likes. Shows platform adoption + creative use cases.

captures.author: @vitrupo
captures.text: David Kipping says something fundamental has shifted in science. At a closed meeting at the Institute for Advanced Study (IAS), top physicists agreed AI can now do up to '90%' of their work and may soon push discovery beyond human understanding.
captures.whyInteresting: Emergency meetings at IAS about AI doing 90% of physicist work. 'I don't know that I want to live in a world where everything around me is just magic.'

captures.author: @minchoi
captures.text: It's happening. Anthropic shipped Claude Cowork plug-ins and software stocks got smoked. Wall Street is calling it 'SaaSpocalypse'. what happened + why
captures.whyInteresting: SaaSpocalypse thread - explains why Anthropic plugins triggered massive software selloff

captures.author: @0xdoug
captures.text: So to recap, AI is expected to create huge amounts of wealth, yetâ€¦ Workers lose, Software corps lose, Tech giants lose, Frontier labs lose, Nvidia loses. So where exactly is the value supposed to accrue?
captures.whyInteresting: The trillion dollar question - if AI creates wealth but everyone loses, where does value go? Sharp analysis.

captures.author: @8teAPi
captures.text: incredible. pointing out that legal LLM hallucinations are interpolating case law that should have/would have existed given existing precedents
captures.whyInteresting: Reframe: LLM hallucinations in legal context are interpolating what case law SHOULD exist given precedents. Fascinating perspective.

captures.author: @TheGeorgePu
captures.text: Claude's plugins works on local files. What was Notion? A fancy UI for markdown files. What was a CRM? A fancy UI for spreadsheets. What was Linear? A fancy UI for task lists. Claude doesn't need the UI. It just does the work. UI layers are now useless.
captures.whyInteresting: Sharp take - SaaS was always fancy UIs over simple data structures. Claude works directly on the files. UI layer obsolescence.

captures.author: @rebound_capital
captures.text: Imagine being a Figma employee who waited a decade for the IPO only to have a 180-day lock-up that ended last week.
captures.whyInteresting: Brutal timing for Figma employees - lockup ended right as software stocks cratered

captures.author: @dougboneparth
captures.text: What we're seeing is a classic rotation from software stocks to poverty.
captures.whyInteresting: Perfect dark humor encapsulation of the software selloff

captures.author: @KevRGordon
captures.text: Software relative to the S&P 500 is a particularly brutal chart ... essentially 6 years of relative gains wiped out
captures.whyInteresting: Data point - 6 years of software outperformance erased in one week

captures.author: @BoringBiz_
captures.text: Anthropic and Claude's recent rise feels like a page taken right out of Peter Thiel's advice from nearly a decade ago - start with a niche that is built around a small market (coding), quickly gain market share in that niche, build reputation...
captures.whyInteresting: Anthropic strategy analysis through Thiel's lens - dominate coding, expand from there

captures.author: @aviel
captures.text: If you work in tech in 2026, you're either at the beginning of your career or at the end of it. If you're acting like you're anywhere else I'm sorry to tell you but you're actually at the end. This holds for VCs too.
captures.whyInteresting: Stark framing - no middle ground in tech careers anymore. Beginning or end.

captures.author: @HungryPawnsX
captures.text: I honestly have no idea if we are close to a crash, a melt up, ww3, an AI industrial revolution, a mother of all short squeezes, a depression, a recession, or aliens. But it sure feels like all of them at once.
captures.whyInteresting: Captures the current moment perfectly - radical uncertainty across every axis

captures.author: @staysaasy
captures.text: One of the interesting things I've seen with AI is people who swear it's making them way more productive, which it is, but it's because they're actually working more. There's some subset of people who were just perpetually procrastinating...
captures.whyInteresting: Interesting observation - AI productivity gains partly come from people just working more, not efficiency

captures.author: @corbin_braun
captures.text: I think any developer that sees what I see is straight up grinding 24/7. we know the walls are collapsing.
captures.whyInteresting: Developer sentiment - urgency and existential pressure from AI capabilities
